shortlist.name: Marnier (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, trained by a top stable, and ridden by a reliable jockey. Current odds indicate strong market confidence and suggest minimal improvement needed for success. Connections and form profile make this the standout contender.

shortlist.name: Shayhana (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Unexposed with no public form but supported in the market, representing a trainer with a good record for debutants. Market position implies ability and readiness, making this the only plausible alternative to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Ten Carat Harry
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is excellent, with two wins in last three starts indicating peak fitness and consistency. Connections are reliable, and odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline in form, making this runner the standout on current evidence.

shortlist.name: Noble Vow (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent placings suggest reliability and readiness to win. Trainer and jockey are proven at this level, and odds indicate respect from the market. Form profile is progressive, with no major negatives.

shortlist.name: Green Dame (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent top-four finishes and recent runner-up effort point to solid form and fitness. Trainer is in good form, and odds are competitive. Connections and recent results suggest this runner is ready to contend.

shortlist.name: Beccadelli
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with two fourth-place finishes in likely stronger company, now facing a weaker field. Trained by Charlie Appleby, a top yard, and partnered with an in-form jockey. Short odds reflect clear market confidence and class edge.

shortlist.name: Ray Mon Dough
shortlist.rationale: Debutant from a respected stable with a leading jockey booked. Market support suggests ability and readiness. No form but connections and odds indicate strong chance if favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Bella Perla (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in top form, having won last time out and with a recent profile of two wins in last four starts. Represents a leading yard and has the best recent figures in the field. Odds are short but justified by clear form superiority and connections.

shortlist.name: Lady Of Arabia
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with three consecutive thirds, indicating reliability at this level. While lacking a recent win, she is holding her form and is the most likely to capitalize if the favourite underperforms. Connections are solid and odds offer some value for a place or upset.

shortlist.name: All Ways Glamorous
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple runner-up finishes and a win in last eight starts. Proven ability to hold form and compete at this level. Connections have kept the horse fit and competitive, and current odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: The Thames Boatman
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent placer with several seconds in recent runs, indicating reliability and readiness. Trainer and jockey combination is respected at this venue. Odds suggest genuine winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Cardinal Point
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 4.4 exchange (solid favourite, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two places in last four starts, indicating peak fitness and reliability. Connections are respected and odds reflect strong market support. No sign of decline in form cycle.

shortlist.name: Sapphire Sirocco
shortlist.rationale: Back-to-back runner-up finishes signal current improvement and readiness to win. Recent form is progressive and odds are competitive for a horse knocking on the door.

shortlist.name: Advertorial
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and third last time out show ability to compete at this level. Reliable profile with top jockey/trainer combination. Odds offer value for a proven performer.

shortlist.name: Arthur Rose (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here off a strong second last time, showing clear recent improvement and fitness. Consistent with top jockey booking and is well found in the market, suggesting stable confidence. No need for major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: My Boy Harry
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner two starts ago and generally consistent at this level. Reliable profile, holding form, and represents value as a proven performer in similar company.

shortlist.name: Rainbow Sign
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 7 exchange (third in market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts back and placed last time, indicating current form is strong. Versatile and consistent, with a top jockey booked. Should be competitive again without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Night Arc
shortlist.rationale: Night Arc arrives off a win last time out, indicating peak fitness and recent improvement. The horse is favoured in the market, suggesting strong confidence from both bookmakers and exchange backers. Connections are solid, and the form profile shows readiness for another big run.

shortlist.name: Chico Dulce
shortlist.rationale: Chico Dulce has shown consistent placed form this season, including a solid third and fourth in recent starts. The odds reflect genuine market respect, and the horse's profile suggests reliability without needing major improvement. Connections are capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Spirit Of Breeze (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner with two wins in last four starts, showing upward form cycle. Connections are reliable and the odds are competitive for a horse with proven recent ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Holy Fire
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up last time out, indicating return to form. Trainer and jockey combination is respected, and market support suggests strong chance. No major improvement needed to win.

shortlist.name: Cape Ashizuri (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as favourite, proven connections, and recent win two starts back indicates current fitness. The fifth last time can be forgiven given the step up in class; overall profile suggests readiness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Saber Strike (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with William Haggas and Rossa Ryan, both highly effective at this venue. Lack of form figures suggests debut or lightly raced, but market respect and stable reputation imply readiness and ability. Should be competitive if showing typical stable improvement.

shortlist.name: Kiss For An Angel (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/4 (exchange 2.5), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes followed by a solid fifth, indicating reliability at this level. Trained by Richard Fahey, a proven operator at Redcar, and the market support is significant. No sign of regression and holds the best form credentials in the field.

shortlist.name: Aleen
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in the market at 11/4 (exchange 5.5), holding value as main danger.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with recent placings and a trainer renowned for improving types at this stage of the season. Luke Morris is a positive booking. Form is solid and competitive for this grade, and odds reflect realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Charlotte Corday (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-supported at 7/2 (exchange 4.6), respected in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures suggest ability to be competitive, with a third and seventh in decent company. Ed Walker's runners often improve for experience, and Paul Mulrennan is a capable jockey at this venue. Market position confirms she is not an outsider.

shortlist.name: Highfield Viking
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins and places this campaign, indicating sustained form. Recent runs suggest fitness and ability to compete at this level. Connections are reliable, and current odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Tactical Plan
shortlist.rationale: Regularly competitive in similar company, with several recent placings. Trainer and jockey combination is respected. Odds indicate market respect, and form suggests the horse is holding condition without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Look Back Smiling (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level with several close finishes. Recent form is solid, and the horse has not shown signs of regression. Connections are capable, and odds are competitive for a horse with proven ability in similar races.

shortlist.name: Alcarath (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a place in last two starts, suggesting strong current form. Top jockey booking and respected trainer. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and form credentials.

shortlist.name: Have Secret (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with recent runner-up finish. Trainer in good form and odds indicate market respect. Reliable profile for the places and could capitalize if favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Mission Possible
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, trained by a top yard, and holds the strongest market support. Connections are in excellent form and the horse is proven at this level, making him the standout on both form and value.

shortlist.name: Codiak (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent 2nd and 5th, lightly raced and open to improvement. Trainer is adept with this type and the odds reflect genuine market respect. Should be competitive if building on last run.

shortlist.name: Crocodile Power (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 3.35 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, winning last time out and consistently placing in recent starts. Connections are in good order and the horse is well found in the market, indicating confidence. No sign of regression and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: One Of Our Own
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 6 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with several placings and a competitive run last time. Odds reflect realistic winning chance without being overbet. Connections are capable and the horse is holding form well.

shortlist.name: Missmimi
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.9 Exchange (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win, indicating reliability and fitness. Odds reflect strong market confidence. Connections have delivered competitive performances at this level.

shortlist.name: Giselles Izzy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent placings suggest peak form and suitability for conditions. Trainer is respected for placing horses well at Redcar. Odds indicate genuine contender status.

shortlist.name: Kyber Crystal (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 5 Exchange (value odds, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Latest win signals improvement and readiness. Form shows competitive efforts in similar races. Trainer has a good record with sprinters at this venue. Odds offer value for a horse in upward form.

shortlist.name: Oilisa
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, showing clear progression and fitness. Connections are in good order and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No sign of regression and recent form is superior to rivals.

shortlist.name: Fire Eyes (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with multiple recent placings and a win, indicating reliability and current well-being. Trainer and jockey combination is respected at this level. Holds form and is unlikely to need major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Love You Back (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as favourite, representing an in-form yard. Connections are reliable at Warwick and the horse is expected to be fit and ready. Absence of recent form is a minor concern but not unusual for a debutant from this stable.

shortlist.name: Stardrop
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes, indicating readiness and reliability. Jockey is a proven performer at this track. Odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse is knocking on the door for a win.

shortlist.name: Scarlet Moon
shortlist.rationale: Recent third-place finish shows competitive ability. Trainer is adept with young horses and the odds suggest genuine respect from the market. Connections have a good strike rate with similar profiles.

shortlist.name: Moon Over America (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as clear favourite, representing a top stable with a proven jockey. Recent runner-up finish suggests readiness and fitness. Connections are highly respected and the horse is expected to improve on debut form.

shortlist.name: Ice In The Veins (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and placed efforts in last three starts. Trained by Dan Skelton, who excels with young hurdlers, and partnered by stable jockey Harry Skelton. Market position reflects strong chance and reliable profile.

shortlist.name: Go West (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive wins (111) demonstrates peak fitness and form trajectory. Paul Nicholls is elite trainer with strong strike rate. Harry Cobden is top-tier jockey. Shortest odds reflect market confidence. Form pattern shows horse is on the improve and ready to perform.

shortlist.name: Deep Purple (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows two consecutive wins (42) with consistent placings (3,4,4,2). Dan Skelton is proven elite trainer; Harry Skelton is accomplished jockey. Form demonstrates horse is in current winning sequence and maintaining competitive edge. Reasonable odds for quality connections and recent winning form.

shortlist.name: Josh The Boss
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with recent placing (8) following layoff period. Twiston-Davies is respected trainer. Form suggests horse may be recovering fitness post-break and could be ready for improved performance. Odds offer value relative to trainer credentials.

shortlist.name: Ez Tiger (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.9 exchange (clear market leader, strong support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, progressive profile with two wins from last four starts and no major form dips. Recent win confirms current fitness and suitability for the grade. Connections are in good form and market strength is notable.

shortlist.name: Jet Patrol (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 6 exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and generally competitive at this level. Patchy profile but has shown ability to win in similar company. Odds reflect realistic chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Mad Maxios (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6.6 exchange (well found in market, lightly raced this season)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with progressive form last season, including a win. Only one run this campaign (fifth), but entitled to come on for that and represents a yard in form. Market respect suggests improvement expected.

shortlist.name: Chuggy
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a win last time, indicating peak fitness and readiness. The Skelton team is highly respected for placing horses well at Warwick. Recent form is progressive and odds are strong for a leading chance.

shortlist.name: Zestful Hope (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out, showing improvement and ability to handle current conditions. Connections are in good form and the horse has a consistent profile, making him a reliable contender at fair odds.

shortlist.name: Ballynaheer (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite on exchange (2.08), solid 5/2 with bookmakers.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes and a win in last five starts. Proven ability to hold form, connections in good order, and market support is strong. No signs of decline and profile fits a reliable contender at this level.

shortlist.name: Got A Dream (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support; 85/40 SBK, 3.35 exchange (clear favourite).
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a decisive win last time, indicating peak fitness and readiness. Connections are solid, and the recent form is progressive. Odds reflect strong confidence from both bookmakers and exchange backers.

shortlist.name: Datsalrightcharlie (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market; 7/2 SBK, 4.6 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win and a good second on seasonal return, suggesting further improvement is likely. Trainer and jockey are in good form, and odds indicate genuine market respect.

shortlist.name: Knight Of Magic (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, showing reliability and fitness. Connections are in good order and the horse is well supported in the market, indicating strong confidence. No major improvement needed and profile fits winner criteria for this grade.

shortlist.name: Naughty Niall
shortlist.rationale: Regularly in the frame with a win and several places in recent starts, demonstrating proven ability at this level. Trainer is respected and odds are competitive, suggesting genuine market support. Reliable profile and no signs of declining form.

shortlist.name: Simply Blue
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 5.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win and multiple placings, indicating peak form. Odds reflect strong market confidence and connections are in good order. No sign of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Maris Angel
shortlist.rationale: Arrives off back-to-back wins, showing clear improvement and ability to hold form. Odds are competitive and recent form is among the best in the field.

shortlist.name: Macarone
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 5.7 exchange (solid value, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last three starts, suggesting further improvement is possible. Odds offer value relative to recent form and connections.

shortlist.name: No Claims Bonus
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.5 exchange (market leader, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent third indicating improvement. Trainer Harry Eustace is respected for placing horses well at this level. Current odds reflect strong market support, suggesting confidence from connections and punters. No major improvement needed based on recent form.

shortlist.name: Kuiama (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3 exchange (solid second favorite, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish signals readiness and fitness. Trainer Dylan Cunha has a good record with similar types at Wolverhampton. Odds are competitive, indicating market respect. Consistent recent form and no signs of decline.

shortlist.name: Filly Foden (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.8 exchange (third choice, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent, regularly placing in competitive fields. Trainer Alice Haynes is adept with all-weather runners. Odds offer fair value for a horse with proven reliability and no need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Albaydaa (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a 3rd and 2nd in last two starts, indicating consistency and readiness to win. Trained by William Haggas, a top-level trainer, and has the best odds, suggesting market confidence. No signs of decline and likely at peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Pierchic
shortlist.rationale: Represents the powerful Charlie Appleby yard, which excels with debutants and all-weather runners. Market support is strong, and connections are highly respected. While unraced, the odds and trainer/jockey combination suggest significant potential.

shortlist.name: Native Spirit
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 (SBK), 3.05 (exchange)  clear market leader, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placings, indicating reliability and readiness. Trained by Charlie Appleby, a top-level trainer, and holds strong market support. No signs of regression and should be competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Heed (Aus)
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut win followed by a below-par effort, but remains prominent in the market. George Boughey is a respected trainer, and the odds suggest confidence in a rebound. Early winning form is a positive indicator.

shortlist.name: Likealot
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple top-three finishes, including a win last start. Trainer Ralph Beckett is in good form and the jockey-trainer combo is proven. Currently the market leader for good reason, showing both fitness and class.

shortlist.name: Solarize
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is strong with a win and two top-three finishes in last three runs. Trainer Charlie Johnston is reliable and the horse is peaking at the right time. Slightly longer odds than Likealot but still represents value given current form and connections.

shortlist.name: Political Power (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support (11/4 SBK, 4.1 exchange); clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes in last four starts, indicating fitness and reliability. Connections are solid and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of decline in form, and has proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: The Hare Rail (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market (16/5 SBK, 5.9 exchange).
shortlist.rationale: Has placed in three of last five runs, showing consistency and competitiveness at this grade. Trainer and jockey combination is respected. Odds indicate genuine support and recent form suggests readiness to win.

shortlist.name: Wilhelmina
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed (11/2 SBK, 6 exchange); not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish and a win three starts back highlight current form and fitness. Trainer is in good form and the horse has shown ability on all-weather surfaces. Odds offer value for a runner with proven recent performance.

shortlist.name: Strobelight (Ger)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a strong 2nd last time out, progressive profile, and represents a trainer in good form. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and suitability for this grade.

shortlist.name: Kingsclere (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 8 exchange (solid second-favorite, some value on exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Improving profile with two recent placings, lightly raced this season, and has a top jockey booked. Connections are respected and the horse is likely to be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Kish Bank (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with two wins in last five starts, trained by Gordon Elliott and ridden by top jockey J. W. Kennedy. The only concern is a poor seasonal reappearance, but this is a common bounce factor after a layoff and the market support is notable. Connections and profile suggest a return to form is likely.

shortlist.name: Hitak (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and a placed effort last time, indicating fitness and consistency. Trainer is in form and the horse has shown ability to bounce back from poor runs. Odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Bossofthebrownies (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with multiple seconds and thirds, suggesting reliability and readiness. Trainer and jockey are respected, and the horse is likely to be competitive again based on recent form and odds.

shortlist.name: Ballagh Star (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes in off a win and consistent recent form, indicating peak fitness. Odds are short, suggesting confidence from the market. Connections have placed the horse well at this level.

shortlist.name: Aclass (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is competitive with a close second two starts back and a respectable fourth last time. Trainer is in decent form and the odds offer value for a horse with proven consistency.

shortlist.name: Malton Groove (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability at this level with placed efforts in the past. Trainer is capable in these handicaps and the odds suggest the horse is not overlooked by the market.

shortlist.name: Whats New (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 2.6 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes in last three starts, indicating reliability and fitness. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest a high probability of a bold showing.

shortlist.name: Adrienne (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.7 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Promising third on debut, showing ability and scope for improvement. Trainer is respected and the market position signals expectation of further progress. No major negatives in profile and should be competitive if building on initial effort.

shortlist.name: I'll Be Handy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Only modest on debut but open to significant improvement on second start. Trainer has a good record with similar types and market support is notable. Not as strong on form as the top two, but respected on potential and connections.

shortlist.name: Hygge
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Gordon Elliott and leading jockey J. W. Kennedy. Market leader with solid support on both sportsbook and exchange, indicating strong confidence. No negative form signals and likely well-prepared for this assignment.

shortlist.name: Code Name Cubitt (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Gavin Cromwell, who excels with this type. Odds are competitive and suggest market respect. No major negatives in profile; logical contender if favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Circle Of Secrets (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Emmet Mullins is a shrewd trainer, often targets these races effectively. Odds indicate genuine support. No exposed negatives, and connections are capable of readying one for a big run.

shortlist.name: Le Labo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win on debut and a respectable run in a higher grade next time. Returns after a break for a top stable in good form. Market support is strong, and connections are highly respected. No evidence of needing major improvement; profile fits a likely winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Whinney Hill
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with a win and two placings in last five starts. Pulled up last time but that can be forgiven given overall profile and top connections. Jockey booking is notable. Market rates him a strong contender and form is competitive for this grade.

shortlist.name: Sticwiththeprocess
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.2 exchange (third in betting, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two recent placings and no major negatives in form. Connections are capable, and the horse is holding form. Odds are fair for a horse with proven consistency at this level.

shortlist.name: Kainsbourg (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two seconds in last four starts, indicating reliability and fitness. Trained by Gordon Elliott, a top Irish trainer, and ridden by M. P. Walsh, both strong connections. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Air Of Entitlement (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced but progressive profile with three wins from last five starts. Trained by Henry de Bromhead, a leading trainer, and partnered by a capable jockey. Market support is strong, and form suggests ability to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Bacchanalian
shortlist.rationale: Comes in off back-to-back wins and a solid overall profile, indicating upward trajectory and fitness. Odds are competitive, and connections are in form. No major negatives in recent form or market signals.

shortlist.name: Targa Flavio (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two solid runs since a break, including a close fourth and third in competitive fields. Market support is strong, indicating confidence. Trainer in decent form and runner is race-fit.

shortlist.name: Live To Laugh (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with improving form figures, placing in last two starts. Trainer/jockey combination is respected. Has shown ability to handle similar company and conditions.

shortlist.name: Gentle Annie (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 3.9 exchange (market third choice, notable exchange support)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and open to improvement after a promising third last time. Market support on the exchange is notable. Connections capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Ney (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.5 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in two starts, suggesting significant ability and potential for further improvement. The layoff is a minor concern but the market support and perfect record indicate strong confidence from connections and punters. No evidence of needing major improvement; already proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Better Times Ahead (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 5.1 exchange (solidly in the market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with solid form in competitive races. The booking of top jockey M. P. Walsh is a positive. Has shown ability to run well fresh and does not require major improvement to contend here.

shortlist.name: Kingkong Ciergues (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is solid with two respectable runs this season. Connections are capable and the horse is holding form. Market support suggests expectations of a strong run without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Old Fashioned (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently short odds (1.42), indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Has the most consistent and competitive recent form in the field, regularly placing and showing ability at this level. Trained by C. Binda, a respected local trainer, and partnered with a capable jockey. No signs of decline in recent runs, suggesting readiness to win.

shortlist.name: Slender Silhouette (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with improving form figures and a top jockey/trainer combination. Recent runs indicate the horse is coming to hand and ready to peak. Connections are strong and the horse is not exposed as needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Queensland (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two seconds and a fifth, showing ability to compete at this level. Jockey and trainer are both experienced, and the horse has not shown any major weaknesses or need for significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Emerald Forge (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.42, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two placings and a close third, suggesting readiness and reliability. Trained by M/M de Kock, a top local stable, and partnered with Callan Murray, a leading jockey. Connections and form profile point to a peak performance.

shortlist.name: Master's Lady (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.42, well-backed and not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows progressive improvement and back-to-back runner-up finishes, indicating the horse is knocking on the door for a win. Muzi Yeni is a reliable jockey, and the trainer has a solid record with similar types.

shortlist.name: Wayne (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Short odds (1.22), indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Debuted with a promising 3rd, suggesting natural ability and scope for improvement. Top jockey booking and trainer in form. No need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Arizona Magic (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Short odds (1.22), well-fancied in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form (4th, 5th, 3rd) shows reliability and fitness. Proven ability to place, and could progress further in this field.

shortlist.name: Amandla Ngawethu (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Short odds (1.22), respected in the betting.
shortlist.rationale: Multiple placings this campaign, indicating consistent competitiveness. Recent 2nd suggests peak fitness and readiness. Connections capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Cartagena (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.42, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Cartagena has a notably consistent and high-class recent form, including three consecutive wins and two recent placings, suggesting peak fitness and reliability. The jockey-trainer combination is reputable, and current odds reflect strong confidence from the market.

shortlist.name: Sky Pillar Rock (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Sky Pillar Rock has shown solid recent form with two placings in the last three starts and a win earlier in the campaign. The booking of Gavin Lerena, a top jockey, adds further confidence. Connections are strong and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Chabal (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Chabal comes off a win last time out, showing improvement and readiness. The form cycle suggests the horse is peaking, and the trainer-jockey partnership is experienced. Odds reflect genuine winning chance.

shortlist.name: Itsnowornever (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Itsnowornever is lightly raced but has a recent win and progressive form, indicating upward trajectory and fitness. The odds suggest market confidence, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Nkandla Gold (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple mid-field finishes, suggesting reliability and fitness. Top jockey Gavin Lerena is a notable positive, and the trainer has a solid local record. No signs of decline in recent runs, and odds indicate strong market support.

shortlist.name: Lonely As A Cloud (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and several competitive finishes, indicating ability to perform at this level. Trainer and jockey combination is respected locally. Odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest the horse is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Secret Chord (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win this campaign. Proven ability to compete at this level, and the Zackey/Gray combination is respected locally. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Antonio Gaudi (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Solid form profile with a win and several placings this season. Maintains consistency and fitness, and connections are reliable. Recent runs suggest readiness and competitiveness.

shortlist.name: Vibe Sa (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Early season wins and placings show ability; recent form slightly mixed but still competitive. Top jockey booking and trainer in form. Has shown class and can bounce back.

shortlist.name: Dylan's Champ (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two wins from last three starts, showing strong consistency and ability to handle similar conditions. Connections are reliable, and current odds reflect justified market support.

shortlist.name: Presley (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a close second and fourth, indicating Presley is holding form and competitive at this level. Top jockey and trainer combination adds further confidence.

shortlist.name: Last Car To Pass (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Has hit the frame in several recent starts, demonstrating reliability and ability to compete in this grade. Trainer in form, and odds suggest market respect.

shortlist.name: Madame Pompadour (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent placings indicate strong current form. Top jockey booking adds confidence. Connections have a solid record at this venue. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Sunshine Day (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, suggesting reliability and readiness. Trainer and jockey combination is proven locally. No major improvement needed; holding form well.

shortlist.name: Gamer (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and solid placed efforts show upward trajectory. Trainer is respected and horse appears to be peaking at the right time. Form profile fits race conditions.
